document.title: K-12 Social Studies New Hampshire Curriculum Framework

B979FAA0DFE60131732A68A86D17958E.description: Identify the concepts of values and beliefs. (Themes: B: Civic Ideals, Practices, and Engagement, E: Cultural Development, Interaction, and Change, I: Patterns of Social and Political Interaction)

B979B530DFE60131732968A86D17958E.description: Students will demonstrate their understanding of the diversity of values, beliefs, and practices of individuals and groups over time.

B9792530DFE60131732768A86D17958E.description: Explore ways that societies around the world express themselves artistically, e.g., songs, dance or clothing. (Themes: J: Human Expression and Communication)

B978CD70DFE60131732668A86D17958E.description: Students will demonstrate their understanding of conceptions of reality, ideals, guidelines of behavior and their forms of expression.

B9787B40DFE60131732568A86D17958E.description: World Views and Value systems and their Intellectual and Artistic Expressions

B9782190DFE60131732468A86D17958E.description: Recognize that people of different countries have different social and political systems. (Themes: A: Conflict and Cooperation, B: Civic Ideals, Practices, and Engagement, I: Patterns of Social and Political Interaction)

B977D920DFE60131732368A86D17958E.description: Students will demonstrate an understanding of major events, ideas and issues pertaining to the history of governance.

B976EFD0DFE60131732068A86D17958E.description: Identify the concept of diversity. (Themes: E: Cultural Development, Interaction, and Change, I: Patterns of Social and Political Interaction, J: Human Expression and Communication)

B976A670DFE60131731F68A86D17958E.description: Identify how the lives of women and children have changed over time in our country. (Themes: B: Civic Ideals, Practices, and Engagement, I: Patterns of Social and Political Interaction)

B97658D0DFE60131731E68A86D17958E.description: Students will demonstrate an understanding of the interaction of various social groups, including their values, beliefs and practices, over time.

B975A870DFE60131731C68A86D17958E.description: Identify different segments of the United States economy, e.g., farm, manufacturing, or retail. (Themes: D: Material Wants and Needs, G: Science, Technology, and Society)

B9754670DFE60131731B68A86D17958E.description: Students will demonstrate an understanding of the changing forms of production, distribution and consumption of goods and services over time.

B974A320DFE60131731968A86D17958E.description: Recognize that groups have enhanced art, music and literature of our nation, e.g., Africa American or Irish. (Themes: E: Cultural Development, Interaction, and Change, F: Global Transformation, J: Human Expression and Communication)

B97459F0DFE60131731868A86D17958E.description: Explore art, music and literature of various time periods, e.g., spirituals or Native American Art. (Themes: J: Human Expression and Communication)

B9741160DFE60131731768A86D17958E.description: Identify individuals and/or groups who have profoundly affected life in the United States, e.g., Abraham Lincoln, or Pilgrims. (Themes: H: Individualism, Equality and Authority, I: Patterns of Social and Political Interaction, J: Human Expression and Communication)

B973BF10DFE60131731668A86D17958E.description: Students will demonstrate an understanding of conceptions of reality, ideals, guidelines of behavior and forms of expression.

B9736A80DFE60131731568A86D17958E.description: World Views and Value systems and their Intellectual and Artistic Expressions

B97324D0DFE60131731468A86D17958E.description: Recognize that the world is interconnected, e.g., trade or transportation. (Themes: C: People, Places and Environment, D: Material Wants and Needs, F: Global Transformation)

B972DE00DFE60131731368A86D17958E.description: Students will demonstrate an understanding of the events, actions and policies of our nation in relation to other peoples and governments over time.

B9724FE0DFE60131731168A86D17958E.description: Identify national and New Hampshire celebrations, monuments, symbols and documents, e.g., flags, Fourth of July, Lincoln Memorial, Constitution. (Themes: A: Conflict and Cooperation, B: Civic Ideals, Practices, and Engagement, E: Cultural Development, Interaction, and Change)

B97204F0DFE60131731068A86D17958E.description: Students will demonstrate an understanding of the major ideas, issues and events pertaining to the history of governance in our state and nation.

B970FBC0DFE60131730D68A86D17958E.description: Investigate how people use resources, e.g., building homes or the food they eat. (Themes: C: People, Places and Environment, D: Material Wants and Needs)

B970A6B0DFE60131730C68A86D17958E.description: Recognize the role of natural resources in daily life, e.g., food, clothing, or shelter. (Themes: A: Conflict and Cooperation, C: People, Places and Environment, D: Material Wants and Needs)

B9703900DFE60131730B68A86D17958E.description: Students will demonstrate an understanding of the connections and consequences of the interactions between Earth's physical and human systems.

B96F9A80DFE60131730968A86D17958E.description: Identify what are natural resources, e.g., water or trees. (Themes: C: People, Places and Environment)

B96F3740DFE60131730868A86D17958E.description: Explore the distribution of a population, e.g., city or farm. (Themes: C: People, Places and Environment)

B96EC400DFE60131730768A86D17958E.description: Students will demonstrate an understanding of human migration; the complexity of cultural mosaics; economic interdependence; human settlement patterns; and the forces of cooperation and conflict among peoples.

B96E1E00DFE60131730568A86D17958E.description: Explore the components and distribution of ecosystems, e.g., desert or rain forest. (Themes: C: People, Places and Environment)

B96DD350DFE60131730468A86D17958E.description: Investigate how the Earth-Sun relationship affects our daily lives, e.g., seasons in New Hampshire or sunlight and shadows. (Themes: C: People, Places and Environment)

B96D8330DFE60131730368A86D17958E.description: Students will demonstrate an understanding of the physical processes that shape the patterns of Earth's surface and the characteristics and spatial distribution of ecosystems.

B96CEB00DFE60131730168A86D17958E.description: Observe the ways in which different people perceive places, e.g., personal drawings or book illustrations. (Themes: G: Science, Technology, and Society, J: Human Expression and Communication)

B96C9A50DFE60131730068A86D17958E.description: Recognize that areas of the Earth's surface share unifying geographic characteristics, e.g., towns, deserts or woodlands. (Themes: C: People, Places and Environment)

B96C2810DFE6013172FF68A86D17958E.description: Explore the physical and human characteristics of place, e.g., roads, schools or mountains. (Themes: C: People, Places and Environment, E: Cultural Development, Interaction, and Change, G: Science, Technology, and Society)

B96BC070DFE6013172FE68A86D17958E.description: Students will demonstrate an understanding of the physical and human geographic features that define places and regions as well as how culture and experience influence people's perceptions of places and regions.

B96B1520DFE6013172FC68A86D17958E.description: Identify major physical and human features in the United States and on Earth, e.g., cities, oceans, or continents. (Themes: C: People, Places and Environment, G: Science, Technology, and Society)

B96AC760DFE6013172FB68A86D17958E.description: Introduce spatial information on maps and other geographic representations, e.g., map key, compass rose. (Themes: C: People, Places and Environment)

B96A7210DFE6013172FA68A86D17958E.description: Identify the characteristics and purposes of globes and maps. (Themes: C: People, Places and Environment, F: Global Transformation)

B96A1010DFE6013172F968A86D17958E.description: Students will demonstrate the ability to use maps, mental maps, globes, and other graphic tools and technologies to acquire, process, report, and analyze geographic information.

B968B720DFE6013172F668A86D17958E.description: Define the term resources, e.g., trees, books (Themes: D: Material Wants and Needs, G: Science, Technology, and Society)

B9686B90DFE6013172F568A86D17958E.description: Students will recognize the importance of international trade and how economies are affected by it.

B967C590DFE6013172F368A86D17958E.description: Describe basic services banks or other financial institutions provide to consumers, savers, borrowers, and businesses. (Themes: D: Material Wants and Needs, H: Individualism, Equality and Authority)

B9677940DFE6013172F268A86D17958E.description: Identify the characteristics of money. (Themes: C: People, Places and Environment, D: Material Wants and Needs, G: Science, Technology, and Society)

B9672860DFE6013172F168A86D17958E.description: Students will understand how financial institutions and the government work together to stabilize our economy, and how changes in them affect the individual.

B9667B30DFE6013172EF68A86D17958E.description: Distinguish between needs and wants. (Themes: D: Material Wants and Needs)

B96624D0DFE6013172EE68A86D17958E.description: Students will learn about the pillars of a free market economy and the market mechanism.

B96587C0DFE6013172EC68A86D17958E.description: Describe the steps and materials needed to make a product, e.g., milk or crayons. (Themes: D: Material Wants and Needs, G: Science, Technology, and Society)

B9653980DFE6013172EB68A86D17958E.description: Define goods and services, producers and consumers. (Themes: D: Material Wants and Needs)

B964F390DFE6013172EA68A86D17958E.description: Students will learn about their role in a free market, how decisions that they make affect the economy, and how changes in the economy can affect them.

B9641500DFE6013172E768A86D17958E.description: Discuss ways individuals can be involved in their community, e.g., food drive or cleaning school grounds. (Themes: B: Civic Ideals, Practices, and Engagement)

B963BB70DFE6013172E668A86D17958E.description: Examine the responsibilities of individuals as members of a family, school and community, e.g., community helpers or chores at home and school. (Themes: B: Civic Ideals, Practices, and Engagement, C: People, Places and Environment)

B9635CA0DFE6013172E568A86D17958E.description: Students will demonstrate an understanding of the rights and responsibilities of citizenship, and the ability to apply their knowledge of local, state, and national government through the political process and citizen involvement.

B962CF10DFE6013172E368A86D17958E.description: Describe why it is important for countries to work together to resolve issues, e.g., disaster relief or famine. (Themes: A: Conflict and Cooperation, F: Global Transformation)

B9628720DFE6013172E268A86D17958E.description: Describe ways in which countries interact with each other culturally. (Themes: E: Cultural Development, Interaction, and Change, F: Global Transformation)

B9623DF0DFE6013172E168A86D17958E.description: Explain that the world is divided into different countries. (Themes: A: Conflict and Cooperation, B: Civic Ideals, Practices, and Engagement, E: Cultural Development, Interaction, and Change)

B961E910DFE6013172E068A86D17958E.description: Students will demonstrate an understanding of the relationship of the United States to other countries, and the role of the United States in world affairs.

B9619480DFE6013172DF68A86D17958E.description: The World and the United States' Place In It

B9614FC0DFE6013172DE68A86D17958E.description: Explain how public officials are chosen. (Themes: A: Conflict and Cooperation, B: Civic Ideals, Practices, and Engagement)

B9610A80DFE6013172DD68A86D17958E.description: Students will demonstrate an understanding of major provisions of the United States and New Hampshire Constitutions, and the organization and operation of government at all levels including the legislative, executive, and judicial branches.

B960C500DFE6013172DC68A86D17958E.description: Structure and Function of United States and New Hampshire Government

B9607B80DFE6013172DB68A86D17958E.description: Evaluate the effectiveness and fairness of rules and laws at the school level. (Themes: A: Conflict and Cooperation, H: Individualism, Equality and Authority)

B9601800DFE6013172DA68A86D17958E.description: Identify the basic purposes of state and national government. (Themes: B: Civic Ideals, Practices, and Engagement)

B95FACC0DFE6013172D968A86D17958E.description: Identify documents and symbols that embody the core ideals of the United States Government, e.g., the bald eagle, the Pledge of Allegiance. (Themes: B: Civic Ideals, Practices, and Engagement, J: Human Expression and Communication)

B95F5C10DFE6013172D868A86D17958E.description: Compare the rules to the classroom and school to the rules of the United States system of government. (Themes: A: Conflict and Cooperation, B: Civic Ideals, Practices, and Engagement, H: Individualism, Equality and Authority)

B95F0470DFE6013172D768A86D17958E.description: Students will demonstrate an understanding of the nature of governments, and the fundamental ideals of government of the United States.

B95EB480DFE6013172D668A86D17958E.description: The Nature and Purpose of Government

B98CF210DFE60131736668A86D17958E.description: Participate in community projects such as voter registration, blood drives, conservation, and heritage activities

B98C8A10DFE60131736568A86D17958E.description: Accept and fulfill responsibilities associated with citizenship in a free society

B98C3150DFE60131736468A86D17958E.description: Work to influence those in leadership positions to strive for extensions of freedom, justice, and human rights

B98BE2D0DFE60131736368A86D17958E.description: Work individually or with others to decide on an appropriate course of action

B98B8DE0DFE60131736268A86D17958E.description: Identify situations in which civic action is required

B98B3F00DFE60131736168A86D17958E.description: Keep informed on issues that affect society

B98AF440DFE60131736068A86D17958E.description: Students will develop civic participation skills:

B98A9FC0DFE60131735F68A86D17958E.description: Participate in persuading, compromising, debating, and negotiating the resolution of conflicts and differences

B98A5450DFE60131735E68A86D17958E.description: Appropriately adjust one's own behavior in response to the dynamics of various groups and situations

B98A0460DFE60131735D68A86D17958E.description: Communicate and defend one's own belief, feelings, and convictions

B9896D20DFE60131735B68A86D17958E.description: Real World Applications of Social Studies Skills

B988D1C0DFE60131735968A86D17958E.description: Take into account relevant ethical values and principles

B98887F0DFE60131735868A86D17958E.description: Identify alternative courses of action and predict likely consequences of each

B98839E0DFE60131735768A86D17958E.description: Secure needed factual information relevant to making the decision

B987DA50DFE60131735668A86D17958E.description: Students will be make informed decisions:

B98774D0DFE60131735568A86D17958E.description: Present in writing (research essays, abstracts, short answers, etc.)

B9871AD0DFE60131735468A86D17958E.description: Present orally (presentation, debate, group discussion, simulation, etc.)

B986D3E0DFE60131735368A86D17958E.description: Present visually (chart, graph, diagram, model, Power Point, etc.)

B98689B0DFE60131735268A86D17958E.description: Students will be able to present information in a variety of ways:

B9863990DFE60131735168A86D17958E.description: Take into account when interpreting events or behaviors context of their time and place

B985CC90DFE60131735068A86D17958E.description: Reinterpret events in terms of what might have happened, and show the likely effects on subsequent events

B9852D60DFE60131734E68A86D17958E.description: Form opinion based on critical examination of relevant information

B984E7D0DFE60131734D68A86D17958E.description: Compare and contrast credibility of differing accounts of the same event

B984A2E0DFE60131734C68A86D17958E.description: Recognize that more than one reasoned interpretation of factual material is valid

B98415D0DFE60131734A68A86D17958E.description: Students will be able to interpret information:

B983C060DFE60131734968A86D17958E.description: Place data in tabular form: charts, graphs, and illustrations

B9837940DFE60131734868A86D17958E.description: Place in proper sequence, i.e., in order of occurrence, including in timelines, or in order of importance, etc.

B9833040DFE60131734768A86D17958E.description: Group data in categories according to appropriate criteria

B982D8E0DFE60131734668A86D17958E.description: Students will be able to clarify information:

B9821C50DFE60131734468A86D17958E.description: Judge websites for reliability, bias, and appropriateness

B9813A90DFE60131734168A86D17958E.description: Students will be able to use appropriate internet resources:

B980F1F0DFE60131734068A86D17958E.description: Gather information by conducting basic statistical analysis

B980A610DFE60131733F68A86D17958E.description: Gather information by conducting polls and group observations

B97FD290DFE60131733D68A86D17958E.description: Students will be able to carry out a variety of information-gathering techniques:

B97F85F0DFE60131733C68A86D17958E.description: Recognize and understand relevant social studies terms.

B97F36C0DFE60131733B68A86D17958E.description: Use appropriate sources to gain meaning of essential terms and vocabulary, glossary, dictionary, texts, word lists

B97EEC20DFE60131733A68A86D17958E.description: Students will be able to find information:

B97EA100DFE60131733968A86D17958E.description: Cite sources, particularly from the Internet, accurately and completely

B97E5410DFE60131733868A86D17958E.description: Utilize various types of sources such as documents, charts, images, artifacts, and maps

B97DF990DFE60131733768A86D17958E.description: Draw from the source information at a level appropriate to the task at hand, i.e., skimming for facts or probing for deeper meaning

B97DA640DFE60131733668A86D17958E.description: Test the validity of information by using such criteria as source, objectivity, technical correctness, currency

B97D0060DFE60131733468A86D17958E.description: Distinguish between facts, interpretations, and opinions

B97C6B60DFE60131733268A86D17958E.description: Distinguish between primary and secondary sources.

B97C1AD0DFE60131733168A86D17958E.description: Students will be able to comprehend the wide range of social studies-related materials by using skills:

B97BD150DFE60131733068A86D17958E.description: Draw on the diversity of social studies-related sources, such as auditory and visual sources, such as documents, charts, pictures, architectural works, and music.

B97B88C0DFE60131732F68A86D17958E.description: Discriminate to select the most worthwhile and trustworthy sources

B97B3F50DFE60131732E68A86D17958E.description: Use economic and geographic data, historical sources, as well as other appropriate sources

B97AF3E0DFE60131732D68A86D17958E.description: Students will be able to find social studies-related information:
